This isn't specifically built for Forms, but there is a community package to add a [Localization module](https://github.com/nittin-cz/xperience-community-localization) which I believe works in a similar fashion to Kentico Xperience 13. I'm not sure if it is usable in Forms though, would need to test that.
You're right about the roadmap, [multilingual forms](https://roadmap.kentico.com/c/226-multilingual-forms) are coming, I would expect this to handle all localisation of forms including the associated error messages, but that would be for Kentico to confirm.
Looking at the error message itself, it looks like Xperience by Kentico is uses `general.requiresvalue` internally as a resource string. I haven't tried this in Xperience by Kentico, but maybe you can register a [resx file](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/customization/integrate-custom-code#store-application-resources-in-resource-files) and add your own translation for it?
``` <data name="general.requiresvalue" xml:space="preserve"> <value>Enter a value.</value> </data> ```
